info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 18 at 3:16PM EDT until March 18 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Caribou ME
info.description:
* WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of East Central Maine, including the following county, Penobscot.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas along the Kenduskeag Stream above Six Mile Falls.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 314 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported minor flooding on the Kenduskeag Stream above Six Mile Falls in Bangor. Rapid river rises have already caused minor flooding above Six Mile Falls. - Above Six Mile Falls is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Large ice chunks are flowing down the stream at times. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bangor, Kenduskeag and Glenburn. - For flood safety visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING
